website_summaries.verdict: A fireplace grate with an extra mesh designed to hold embers close to your logs and keep the fire hotter longer.
pros: Ember holder helps to burn the wood completely and give more heat
cons: The grate ember holder is made from thinner material and has a tendency to fail before the rest of the grate

customer_reviews.title: Burnt through on 4th fire!
customer_reviews.text: Please do not buy this grate if you actually use your fireplace for fires. We live in the Mid Atlantic area and it has been a particularly cold winter season. We used this grate 4 times. As you can see from the pictures, it completely burned through. What you can't see is that it warped forward so that the wood was falling forward. Also, it gave off a bad aroma during all burnings. Unlike any other grate we have used in the past. This is not a product to purchase if you are trying to heat your house. It would be quite useful for decorative fireplaces.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Quality does matter!
customer_reviews.text: I selected a Rocky Mountain Goods Fireplace Grate based on its specifications and the reviews of owners. My previous "bargain priced" steel grate did not hold up well, with several bars sagging and ultimately breaking off. When I inspected the grate that I purchased from Rocky Mountain Goods, I saw that the bars were noticeably heavier, with high quality welds. It also contains a screen to prevent embers from prematurely falling to the floor of the fireplace, which allows more heat to be transmitted. This fact I confirmed after my initial use of the product. All in all, I am very satisfied with my Rocky Mountains Goods Fireplace Grate!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: lasted 26 fire and melted dont buy.
customer_reviews.text: lasted 26 fires 26 days and it is done. this is what is left of this product after 26 days. this is the poor quality product they make and sell.
customer_reviews.author: Brian L. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Great way to make the wood last longer!
customer_reviews.text: We needed a new grate for the fireplace and someone suggested one with an ember retainer would be better than the standard one we had and boy was that right! I can definitely tell a difference in how long the fires last now! Good quality grate without breaking the bank!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: if your fireplace can accommodate a larger fire then I would not recommend this grate
customer_reviews.text: I procrastinated buying a fireplace grate for a while. Then...temperatures dropped below freezing & I realized I needed to utilize the fireplace. I searched endlessly for a fireplace grate & found this one to be at the top of my list with customer reviews to match. This size grate is the ideal size for my fireplace, however, if your fireplace can accommodate a larger fire then I would not recommend this grate. The size of my fireplace is perfect for this grate & I have utiized my fireplace every night since delivered 😍👍🏼 Would 100% recommend for the appropriate sized fire.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Going to throw away
customer_reviews.text: I dont know how durable its going to be. I saw the black paint chip off at the corner i hope that doesnt mean anything? Have had for a couple months now. No option to return. This thing is a joke. Turned white smoky color, cant be good. Looks like i dont want to be breathing that. Going to throw away.
customer_reviews.author: Kat H.

customer_reviews.title: Good for light use/short burning season
customer_reviews.text: Good for a slow or short burning season. Hot fires will make it weak in somewhat short order. Good if ur in A pinch, but if you want something to last more than one season (safely) get a sturdier item.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Rodd

customer_reviews.title: Great quality - use limitations
customer_reviews.text: Nice little grate. Comes assembled and is very sturdy. Just realize that this grate is on the small side. I was looking at the length of it to make sure it fit in our fireplace. The depth is very shallow and will only accommodate one normal size log. Its nearly impossible to stack logs since you cannot put more than one on the bottom. This is NOT a poke in the eye to the manufacturer rather an observation. The product itself is top notch.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Quality Fireplace Grate
customer_reviews.text: We have used this for about a month now and it is as good as new. Very good quality; welds have held together and no warping or deformation observed.
customer_reviews.author: Raymie

customer_reviews.title: NOT sturdy NOT durable
customer_reviews.text: We have an open fireplace. It's MUCH smaller than you think....it's too high to get a fire unless you put a pile of kindling under it first. bent after a month.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too thin and skinny wouldn't last
customer_reviews.text: I returned this item. I felt if I would have put one log on it the wrong way, it would have broke. I purchased a more sturdy one instead.
customer_reviews.author: Terra B.

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable
customer_reviews.text: Not as easy to use as a “full bottomed” grate. I will use this for this season and replace it, regardless of its usefulness, next year.
customer_reviews.author: MPTJR

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Received on time. Looks good and seems solid. We've used it a few times and for the most part I like it. The only thing that I don't like about it is that the front retainer rods of the grate seem a little short making it easy for the wood to roll off the grate when the wood shifts. You have to make sure the wood is pushed farther to the back and stacked so it won't roll.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed with life time warranty...what does this mean?
customer_reviews.text: Very frustrating and disappointing when the advertisement is "lifetime warranty" and the fire grate literally fall apart after ONE 24 hour fireplace burn... Now I have to re-box this grate and send it back to get my refund....REALLY?

customer_reviews.title: however it appears quite sturdy and that it is designed well
customer_reviews.text: Well this is a fireplace grate, so it is not something I get too excited about. I have placed it in my fireplace, but have not used it yet, however it appears quite sturdy and that it is designed well, and it certainly is reasonably priced. I needed a grate that will hold wood, plus small pieces of fatback wood. This will do nicely when the weather warrants a nice roaring fire.

product_meta.title: Rocky Mountain Goods Fireplace Grate with Ember Retainer - 1/2” Heavy Duty Cast Iron -Heat Treated for Hottest Fires - Retainer for Cleaner More efficient fire - Weld has (23")
product_meta.description: Size:23"Rocky Mountain Goods Fireplace Grate with Ember Retainer is the highest quality cast iron fireplace grate on the market. This grate stands out with the quality of the weld and the cast iron used. While lesser quality grates melt or break, this fireplace grate has been heat treated to withstand the hottest of fires. The retainer design also makes for a cleaner and more efficient fire as all wood is burned. The powder coated finish keeps this fireplace grate looking brand new. Welded with the highest end welding equipment we guarantee them with a lifetime warranty.
feature_bullets: Heavy duty cast iron grate can hold the heaviest of logs and wood
Ember retainer makes for a cleaner and hotter fire as all wood is burned
High end weld guaranteed to last
Heat treated metal does not warp or melt like lesser quality grates - Made for the hottest fires

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars453 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
